Feb 3 (Reuters) - :
*AMAZON.COM EXEC - THIRD PARTY SELLERS PROVIDED 56% OF ALL UNIT SALES IN Q4, THE HIGHEST FOURTH QUARTER MIX EVER - CONF CALL *AMAZON CFO SAYS THE COMPANY EXPECTS LABOR-RELATED COST CHALLENGES TO PERSIST IN Q1, ADJUSTED FOR LOWER SEASONAL VOLUMES RELATIVE TO Q4 - CONF CALL *AMAZON CFO- SEE CAPEX FOR INFRASTRUCTURE GOING UP IN 2022 *AMAZON CFO- FULFILLMENT CENTER SPEND MODERATING *AMAZON CFO SEES ADDITIONAL LEVELS OF INVESTMENT IN TRANSPORTATION IN 2022 *AMAZON CFO SAYS DOESN'T EXPECT SUPPLY DISRUPTIONS TO BE A BIG ISSUE IN Q1 - CONF CALL

  • ((Reuters.Briefs@thomsonreuters.com;))
